paragraphs.content: Shiggaion of David, which he sang unto the LORD, concerning the words of Cush the Benjamite.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Shiggaion of David, which he sang unto the Lord, concerning the words of Cush the Benjamite.

paragraphs.content: O LORD my God, in thee do I put my trust: save me from all them that persecute me, and deliver me:
paragraphs.contentHtml: O Lord my God, in thee do I put my trust: save me from all them that persecute me, and deliver me:

paragraphs.content: Lest he tear my soul like a lion, rending it in pieces, while there is none to deliver.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Lest he tear my soul like a lion, rending it in pieces, while there is none to deliver.

paragraphs.content: O LORD my God, if I have done this; if there be iniquity in my hands;
paragraphs.contentHtml: O Lord my God, if I have done this; if there be iniquity in my hands;

paragraphs.content: If I have rewarded evil unto him that was at peace with me; (yea, I have delivered him that without cause is mine enemy:)
paragraphs.contentHtml: If I have rewarded evil unto him that was at peace with me; (yea, I have delivered him that without cause is mine enemy:)

paragraphs.content: Let the enemy persecute my soul, and take it; yea, let him tread down my life upon the earth, and lay mine honour in the dust. Selah.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Let the enemy persecute my soul, and take it; yea, let him tread down my life upon the earth, and lay mine honour in the dust. Selah.

paragraphs.content: Arise, O LORD, in thine anger, lift up thyself because of the rage of mine enemies: and awake for me to the judgment that thou hast commanded.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Arise, O Lord, in thine anger, lift up thyself because of the rage of mine enemies: and awake for me to the judgment that thou hast commanded.

paragraphs.content: So shall the congregation of the people compass thee about: for their sakes therefore return thou on high.
paragraphs.contentHtml: So shall the congregation of the people compass thee about: for their sakes therefore return thou on high.

paragraphs.content: The LORD shall judge the people: judge me, O LORD, according to my righteousness, and according to mine integrity that is in me.
paragraphs.contentHtml: The Lord shall judge the people: judge me, O Lord, according to my righteousness, and according to mine integrity that is in me.

paragraphs.content: Oh let the wickedness of the wicked come to an end; but establish the just: for the righteous God trieth the hearts and reins.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Oh let the wickedness of the wicked come to an end; but establish the just: for the righteous God trieth the hearts and reins.

paragraphs.content: My defence is of God, which saveth the upright in heart.
paragraphs.contentHtml: My defence is of God, which saveth the upright in heart.

paragraphs.content: God judgeth the righteous, and God is angry with the wicked every day.
paragraphs.contentHtml: God judgeth the righteous, and God is angry with the wicked every day.

paragraphs.content: If he turn not, he will whet his sword; he hath bent his bow, and made it ready.
paragraphs.contentHtml: If he turn not, he will whet his sword; he hath bent his bow, and made it ready.

paragraphs.content: He hath also prepared for him the instruments of death; he ordaineth his arrows against the persecutors.
paragraphs.contentHtml: He hath also prepared for him the instruments of death; he ordaineth his arrows against the persecutors.

paragraphs.content: Behold, he travaileth with iniquity, and hath conceived mischief, and brought forth falsehood.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Behold, he travaileth with iniquity, and hath conceived mischief, and brought forth falsehood.

paragraphs.content: He made a pit, and digged it, and is fallen into the ditch which he made.
paragraphs.contentHtml: He made a pit, and digged it, and is fallen into the ditch which he made.

paragraphs.content: His mischief shall return upon his own head, and his violent dealing shall come down upon his own pate.
paragraphs.contentHtml: His mischief shall return upon his own head, and his violent dealing shall come down upon his own pate.

paragraphs.content: I will praise the LORD according to his righteousness: and will sing praise to the name of the LORD most high.
paragraphs.contentHtml: I will praise the Lord according to his righteousness: and will sing praise to the name of the Lord most high.
